tender.title: Support for Development and Delivery of the Industrial Energy Efficiency Innovation Programme (IEEA)

lots.description:
This is notification of a variation to an existing contract between The Carbon Trust and BEIS.
The Carbon Trust are the delivery partner for the Industrial Energy Efficiency Accelerator (IEEA). The Carbon Trust are contracted to develop and deliver the IEEA on BEIS behalf. The Carbon Trust bid for the IEEA contract is a consortium with Jacobs, who provide technical support.

amendments.description:
Nature and extent of the modifications (with indication of possible earlier changes to the contract):
Variation 1: GBP 187 138 (total value GBP 1 924 438) due to increased volumes of the programme and undertake the Undertaking in difficulty and financial due diligence activity, not included in the original contract, but required due to a change in state aid legislation.
Variation 2: GBP 257 529 (total value GBP 2 181 967 due to Covid-related delays in projects.
Contract variation 1 documentation is saved on SharePoint here.
On 17 July 2019, in response to a high uptake of the IEEA Phase 2 competition.
amendments.rationale: Need for modification brought about by circumstances which a diligent contracting authority/entity could not foresee: A contract variation is required to extend this contract to allow them to continue managing the projects (which have had to be extended due to Covid-related delays) to completion. An extension will also allow the Carbon Trust to complete evaluation and replication activities once the projects close, as outlined in the original contract.

tender.title: SS16 063 - Intensive Support Services for the HeadStart Kent Programme

lots.title: Intensive Support
lots.description: As a result of the Covid-19 outbreak, the National Lottery Community Fund (NLCF) contacted HeadStart Kent to advise they were focusing all funding activity over the next 6 months in responding to the needs of local communities during the pandemic, including the identification of some additional funding to continue to deliver the existing support for an additional period whilst focusing more on identified groups and increasing sustainability through community involvement.

deliveryLocation.description: HeadStart districts: Swale, Gravesham, Ashford, Shepway, Canterbury, Thanet, Maidstone, Tonbridge and Malling, Dover.

awards.title: Intensive Support Services for the HeadStart Kent Programme

contracts.title: Intensive Support Services for the HeadStart Kent Programme

deliveryLocation.description: Maidstone, Thanet, Tonbridge and Malling, and Dover.

amendments.description:
Nature and extent of the modifications (with indication of possible earlier changes to the contract):
Change the delivery end date of 31 August 2020 for the Maidstone and Thanet Districts, and alter this to 31 December 2020 in Thanet at a cost of GBP 26 564. The expectation is that this will allow for an additional 50 young people to be seen by the service in these areas during this timeframe.
Extend Maidstone by an additional six months from 1 January 2021 to 30 June 2021 and alter the end date in Tonbridge and Malling and Dover by nine months, from 31 March 2021 to 31 December 2021 at a cost of GBP 69 110. The expectation is that this will allow for 91 additional young people to be seen across Maidstone, Tonbridge and Malling, and Dover during this time period.
amendments.rationale: Need for modification brought about by circumstances which a diligent contracting authority/entity could not foresee: The modification is permitted based on the Regulation 32(2)(c) of the PCRs: the National Lottery identified additional funding in order to respond to emerging emotional wellbeing needs of children and young people as a direct result of the Covid-19 pandemic. The Covid-19 situation is so novel that the consequences are not something that could have been predicted by the local authority. In light of the emerging emotional wellbeing needs of children and young people, there is a need to maintain supply, which it may not be possible to achieve whilst complying with the usual timescales in the PCRs. The Covid-19 pandemic is not attributable to KCC, nor could it have been foreseen.

tender.title: University of Sunderland - Minor Works (Main Contractors Framework)

lots.description: The authority seeks to develop a framework agreement for the following: Minor building works contractors for works to GBP 1.5 million. The contractors will be invited to tender for minor building works (subject to the lot value) works that the authority wishes to undertake, these would be direct contracts for the authority and will mainly consist of building refurbishments. It is envisaged that there will be three contractors appointed for each lot and contractors can be appointed for multiple or single lots. The authority has existing frameworks in place for project management, architectural, QS services, structural engineers, CDM and mechanical and electrical engineering services. The University has a major capital contractor for projects over GBP 1.5 million in value and is currently establishing a framework of mechanical and electrical contractors.

awards.title: University of Sunderland - Minor Works (Main Contractors Framework)

contracts.title: University of Sunderland - Minor Works (Main Contractors Framework)

amendments.description: Nature and extent of the modifications (with indication of possible earlier changes to the contract):This contract is being modified in accordance with Regulations 72(1)(c) and 72(1)(b) of the Public Contracts Regulations 2015.The modification will extend the contract for the provision of the MPLA which includes delivery of 4 Academy cohorts and 5 additional major project delivery leadership workshops and support activities for the development of senior level civil service capability. The contract will be extended for up to 18 months from 25 January 2021.The contract was extended beyond the term originally provided for in the procurement documents and the original contract in January 2019 for a period of 2 years. The services provided (the Additional services referred to in Section VII.1.4) were 5 MPLA cohorts and additional major project delivery leadership workshops and support activities for the development of senior level civil service capability. The value of the modification was for up to GBP 4 750 000. More information can be found https://app.panacea-software.com/hq/
amendments.rationale: Need for modification brought about by circumstances which a diligent contracting authority/entity could not foresee: In March 2020 WHO declared Covid-19 a global pandemic. The need for this contract modification has been brought about by the impact of Covid-19 on the current MPLA delivery and tender process for the new contract which could not have been foreseen by the contracting authority. The MPLA is primarily delivered as a face to face 18 month programme, national restrictions have led to a backlog of teaching commitments and services. The impact of Covid-19 on IPA resource, and other critical government stakeholders, have resulted in delays to the procurement process for the new contract which the contracting authority had intended to commence in 2020. Additionally the complexity and bespoke nature of MPLA means it is not possible for a change of contractor before the planned procurement due to substantial duplication of costs and the investment in time required (under Regulation 72(1)(b)).

classification.description: Demolition, site preparation and clearance work

tender.description: The Procure Public Demolition Framework has been successfully procured to cover a range of clearance services including:— crushing and screening,— cutting and sawing,— demolition,— dismantling,— domestic,— explosive,— groundworks, civils and enabling,— high reach,— mechanical,— reclamation,— site clearance,— small works,— structural alterations and strip out,— top down/deconstruction,— waste management.The framework is accessible by all public sector bodies throughout the UK (and any future successors to these organisations):A full list of potential contracting authorities can be found here under the most recent file:https://www.ons.gov.uk/economy/nationalaccounts/uksectoraccounts/datasets/publicsectorclassificationguideThe following public bodies may also use the framework agreement:http://www.wales.com/study/universities-waleshttp://gov.wales/topics/improvingservices/devolution-democracy-delivery/register-of-public-bodies/?lang=en

lots.description: The framework has been procured in accordance with guidelines provided by the National Federation of Demolition Contractors.

description: In section I.2), it is stated that this procurement is a joint procurement. This is not a joint procurement it is operated by BSO PaLS on behalf of the Belfast Health and Social Care Trust. The value in V.2.4) above includes: an initial contract period of 2 years, plus an option to extend for 36 x 1-month periods (3 years). The value also includes a potential increase in services of 20 %. Social care services such as the provision of primary care talking therapies are classified under the Public Contracts Regulations as social and other specific services and fall within those services listed in Schedule 3 to the Public Contracts Regulations. This tender is therefore subject to the provisions of section 7 of the Public Contracts Regulations otherwise known as the ‘Light Touch Regime’. As such, new entrants will be allowed to apply to join the DFA. The DFA will be opened for new entrants initially within 1 month of the award and thereafter on an annual basis. Providers/applicants seeking admission as a new entrant to the DFA will be required to complete the same process as the original competition to ensure equal treatment and transparency. A new contract notice will be issued inviting interested providers to submit a response should they wish to participate in the DFA.

lots.description: Supply, installation and removal of electrical appliances and associated white goods:Key requirements:— supply of items;— delivery of items to locations across the UK;— installation/fitting of items (where applicable);— decommissioning of old items (where applicable);— removal of items and packaging;— flexibility on lead times (contractors will need to provide their standard lead times and delivery times);— options around the turnaround times for supply of items in an emergency;— help-desk facility for ordering and enquiries;— management information reporting.

description: The Shropshire Healthcare Procurement Services (‘SHPS’) is a shared Procurement Service for the Hospitals in Shropshire and is carrying out this procurement for on behalf of member Trust(s).Member Trusts include: The Robert Jones and Agnes Hunt Orthopaedic Hospital NHS Foundation Trust, Shrewsbury and Telford Hospitals NHS Trust and Shropshire Community Health NHS Trust. The tender documentation will detail the participating authorities relevant to this tender.Submission of expressions of interest and procurement specific information: the Authority is using the ADB Multiquote e-tendering portal to conduct the procurement process (‘the e-Tendering Portal’). The e-Tendering Portal can be accessed https://suppliers.multiquote.com under project referenced in the advert. In order to participate, potential bidders must download the documents contained in the portal and complete and publish by the deadline date. Login to the portal with the username/password. Click on the relevant project to access the content and follow the onscreen instructions. If you require any further advice, contact the e-Tendering Help Desk.

tender.title: Tender for the Design and Installation of Electrical Works
tender.description: The Robert Jones and Agnes Hunt Orthopaedic Hospital NHS Foundation Trust wishes to implement energy cost and carbon saving measures to reduce its total energy bill and carbon emissions by 20 % by 2020 to meet stringent budget constraints as well as carbon reduction obligations.

lots.description: This project was initiated by an energy survey to identify technical opportunities to reduce energy costs and carbon emissions across the site to meet ever increasing financial and environmental pressures. From the survey a number of electrical improvements were identified as follows:— LED lighting,— PIR sensors,— PoU time fused spurs,— Street lighting,— Variable speed drives.

tender.reviewDetails: :Shropshire Healthcare Procurement Service will allow a standstill period at the point the decision regarding the award of the contract is communicated to tenderers. The standstill period shall be in accordance with Regulation 87 of the Public Contracts Regulations 2015.

awards.title: Tender for the Design and Installation of Electrical Works
